arm_group.description: This is a non-supplemented control group that will follow the same dietary and medication restrictions.  The purpose of this group is to ensure results are due to supplementation and not due to random dietary exposure.

brief_summary.textblock:
The main hypothesis of this study is that there will be a significant increase of
      Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG (LGG) and Bifidobacterium lactis (BB-12) in the stool of healthy
      humans following daily consumption of a probiotic supplement containing these specific
      strains of probiotic bacteria.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fecal Recovery of the Probiotic Bacteria Lactobacillus Rhamnosus GG (LGG) and Bifidobacterium Animalis Subspecies Lactis BB-12 (BB-12) in Healthy Humans Following Daily Consumption of a Probiotic Supplement

detailed_description.textblock: To demonstrate recovery of live probiotic bacteria in the stool.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Are between 18-70 years of age. Have regular bowel movements. Are willing and able to
        attend study visits, undergo limited blood and urine testing, take the nutritional
        supplement according to the instructions provided.

        Are willing to collect four stool specimens and bring them to the study site.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Are unwilling to follow the dietary guidelines of the study. Are lactose-intolerant or
        have allergies to milk or wheat. Have had drug or alcohol problems within the previous
        year. Are or plan to become pregnant over the next 3 months.

intervention.description: Dosage is 1 individually wrapped packet (1 gram) containing probiotic powder per day for 21 days

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Two Arm, Parallel Group, Open Label, Single Center Prospective Study of the Fecal Recovery of Lactobacillus Rhamnosus GG (LGG) and Bifidobacterium Animalis Subspecies Lactis (BB-12) in Healthy Humans Following Daily Consumption of ProNutrients Probiotic Powder Sachet

primary_outcome.description: Pre- to post-supplementation changes in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR
primary_outcome.measure: Change in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR at baseline and 3 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Pre- to post-supplementation changes in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR at baseline and 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Pre- to post-supplementation changes in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative PCR (qPCR)
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative PCR (qPCR) at baseline and 3 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Pre- to post-supplementation changes in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative PCR (qPCR)
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative PCR (qPCR) at baseline and 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Pre- to post-supplementation changes in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR and qPCR in probiotic compared to control group
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR and qPCR in probiotic compared to control group at baseline and 3 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Pre- to post-supplementation changes in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR and qPCR in probiotic compared to control group
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fecal concentration of both LGG and BB-12 by quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR and qPCR in probiotic compared to control group at baseline and 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Post-supplementation fecal concentration of LGG and BB-12 by both quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR and qPCR compared to baseline and 3 week supplementation values
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fecal concentration of LGG and BB-12 by both quantitative culture with confirmatory PCR and qPCR at baseline, 3 weeks, and 28 days post supplementation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
